experience.description:
At Kraftvaerk I was a part of mobile department from the very beginning. I participated in most mobile projects in different roles: starting as a developer, then as senior developer and a tech lead/architect. We started from a ground up and achieved with solid architecture approaches, code requirements and its reviews, and CI/CD infrastructure. Apart of technical design and app's implementation I was involved in planning and estimations, creating POCs, meetings with clients, hiring processes and mentoring. 
 
Project: Clever 
TechStack: Kotlin, MVVM(LiveData) + Architecture components + Coroutines, Clean Arch., Jetpack Navigation, Room, Koin, AnroidX, Firebase, Azure DevOps, Adobe XD 
Responsibilities: - Architecting mobile application. Designing and developing functionality: Pixel perfect UI styles (Material Components), business logic, WebAPI integration, utilizing Jetpack Navigation. 
- CI and CD with Azure DevOps and AppCenter. 
Highlights: Conducting technical interviews to find a teammate. Mentoring junior Android developer. Code review. 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=dk.clever.app 
 
Project: List101 
TechStack: Java/Kotlin, MVP(Mosby) +Interactors, RxJava, Dagger, Butterknife, Glide, TeamCity, Fabric 
Responsibilities: - Tech leading a new social-network mobile application from the scratch. Controlling project and task work flow. Code review. 
- Creating interface wire frames and mind maps aligned with client requirements. 
- Designing architecture. Providing solutions to complex issues with an app: memory optimizations, DI. 
- Designing REST API. Network integration within app. 
- Implementing app's functionality: UI, animation, logic, data persistence. 
- Working with video streaming (ExoPlayer) and images galleries. 
Highlights: Leading a team of two Android developers and deliver results in line with client requirements. Conducting interviews to shape an Android team for a project. 
http://www.list101global.com/

Project: Group of three Q8 apps for Denmark and Sweden. 
TechStack: Java/Kotlin, MVP(custom realization) + Command Executor(backed by AsyncTasks), Firebase services, Picasso, Leakcanary, ProuGuard, Zeplin. 
Responsibilities: - Took over an app based on "God" Activities. Refactored it to MVP approach with modern stack (ButterKnife, Retrofit, Picasso). 
- Gathered all three apps in one codebase. Common and specific functionality’s separated by build system(flavors) and design patterns. It allows to easily add new functionality. 
- App's based on flexible architecture smoothly went through two total redesigns. 
- Migration to Kotlin, Constraint Layout, Koin, AndroidX. 
- UI, logic, persistence, push notifications, remote configurations, camera, maps clustering, analytics (GTM, Firebase) 
- Creating custom Gradle tasks to have flexible per app configurations, and for creating release notes. 
- Gathering client requirements, making investigations and calculating estimates. Implementing POCs. 
- TeamCity integration. Hockeyapp, later Fabric Beta. 
Highlights: 
- Developing new functionality, app maintaining, refactoring, delivering apps to the GP Store for 4 years. 
- Close collaboration with developers, managers and client's partners across different countries. 
- Discussion a project with clients, conducting presentations with improvements ideas for products. 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=dk.q8.mobileapp&hl=en 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=se.q8.mobileapp&hl=en

Project: Falck Vejhjælp 
TechStack: Java, MVVM(DataBinding), Dagger, AsyncTasks, SQLite, EventBus 
Responsibilities: 
- Designing and implementing new functionality. Refactoring and bugfixing. 
- Enhance performance and stability according to best engineering practices. 
- UI with animations(Lottie), map and location functionality, REST API, DB. 
- Migration to Azure DevOps from Team City. 
- Espresso Tests. 
Highlights: - Communications with a client regarding technical aspects directly. Collaboration with a client to "uberise" the app. 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.visma.falck.android.assistance&hl=en 
 
Project: Kraftboard - internal social network. 
TechSatck: Java/Kotlin, MVP(Mosby), RxJava 
Responsibilities: Implementing various functionality: Chart rendering, settings, push notifications.

Map module implementation for a banking app. 
TechStack: Java, Android Annotations, Eventbus, Yandex Map Kit 
Responsibilities: Working with Yandex Map SDK. Adapting usage of Google Clustering utils within Yandex map. Migration the whole project to Gradle. UI animations and business logic.

At 2nova I became an Android developer and learned platform basics. 
Projects: Various product, advertisement and internal apps. 
TechStack: Java, Fragments, REST, Sockets, Raw SQLite, ORMLite, Files, Support Library. 
Responsibilities: - Implementing UI by design, business logic, designing and documenting REST API. 
- Creating apps from a scratch. Working in a team. Participation in architecture design. 
- Working with background services and thread concurrency. 
- Gestures, animations, GCM pushes, Notifications, Alarms, Geofences, Analytics, 
- Apps publishing. 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.strategydeck&hl=ru 
https://2nova.ru/works/mytask

Working in a field of marketing I gained experience in implementing projects right on time in quite strict time frames. As well as that I learned how to design flexible apps that could easily meet change request even right before a release date. 
Projects: Versatile desktop and web apps for big brands and worldwide events, like Olympic games. 
TechStack: AS3, Flex/Flash/AIR, Feathers, HTML, SQLite, REST, Sockets, XML 
Responsibilities: - Implementing apps and small games for social networks. UI, logic, networks (HTTP & Sockets), JSON. 
- Working with audio, video, 3d (Stage 3D) graphics, animations. 
- Designing apps from a scratch. Leading a project of 2 flash developers. Controlling project and task work flow. Code review. Documenting a codebase. Close work with backenders. 
- Investigation, testing and applying new technologies and libraries. Performance optimizations. 
https://2nova.ru/works/samsung-roadshow

Flex web app for rendering currency rates and graphics in real-time. 
Communication with a backend by ZMQSocket.

In this company I first time met an enterprise development and learned how to work in a team and deliver a quality result. 
Projects: Desktop, self-service terminals and web apps. 
TechStack: AS3, Flex/Flash/AIR, HTML, CSS, JS, php, MySQL, SQLite, SVN. 
Responsibilities: - Developing software for self-service terminals. Implementing modules, working with billing services and cashier devices. Implementing payment engine with guaranteed delivery. 
- Developing Flex client apps working with SOAP services. 
- Participating in GIS projects. Working with OpenScales map engine, objects, layers and charts. 
http://www.petrosoft.su/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=99%3Ainfopoliscatalog&catid=37%3Asolutions&Itemid=91&lang=ru 
http://www.petrosoft.su/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=84%3Adou&catid=37%3Asolutions&Itemid=77&lang=ru%22

Small browser games. Arkanoid and game with falling balls. 
Implementing simple physics and objects interaction.

experience.company: The institute of drop jet technologies (EDJT)
experience.description:
Designing and implementing software that imitates UI and behavior of real printer. This solution's used to teach workers how to use printers, and also is used to record video lessons. 
This was my final project in University.

Creating a website for TV equipment seller. Designing and implementing tiny CMS to manage website and product catalogue. 
TechStack: PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS.
